chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer
Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
The defendant Tristan D. Schroeder was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
2:19 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Tristan D. Schroeder in court.  Attorney Dominic J. Anderson in court for Tristan D. Schroeder.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Anderson approaches bench with plea questionnaire and waiver of rights. 

Court reviews plea questionnaire and waiver of rights form with defendant. Defendant states understanding. Court reviews the constitutional and fundamental rights with Defendant. Defendant states understanding. Court reviews the elements of the charge with defendant. Defendant states understanding. Court reviews the minimum / maximum penalties with defendant. Defendant states understanding. 

Court asks defendant for plea. Defendant enters a no contest plea to both counts. Court accepts the defendants no contest pleas and finds that the defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily enters plea. Court finds the defendant guilty.  

Ct1 - 946.41(1) - Resisting or Obstructing an Officer (1) No Contest to the amended charge 
Ct2 - 947.01(1) - Disorderly Conduct (1) No Contest 

State is heard on sentencing recommendations. State requests a withheld sentence, probation 2yrs, prohibitions to include Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages, nor enter any taverns. Defendant shall have no contact with TS and CS.  Defendant is to submit to any testing probation deems appropriate. Participate in any other assessments as deemed appropriate by the Department of Corrections and follow through with recommended counseling, treatment or programming. 

Attorney Anderson is heard. 

Court orders for count 1 and count 2 identical sentences...a withheld sentence, probation 2yrs, Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages, nor enter any taverns unless approved by probation agent. Defendant shall have no contact with TS and CS. Defendant is to submit to any random testing probation deems appropriate. Participate in any other assessments as deemed appropriate by the Department of Corrections and follow through with recommended counseling, treatment or programming. AODA assessment and follow through with treatment. Court Costs $443.00. Total $886.00. Bond to be applied.60DTP. Jail Credit 3 days in the event that probation is revoked. No restitution to be ordered.

Attorney Anderson is heard on the status of the case.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

records.addlTxt:
2:05 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Tristan D. Schroeder in court.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant is heard on the status of retaining an attorney.  He does not qualify for a public defender. 
Court reviews defendants ability to pay for an attorney. Court will file the petition but will not act on it yet.  Court will give defendant a couple weeks to save up and retain an attorney.  If defendant can not court will appoint an attorney for him. 
Court will continue.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

2:03 pm. -Case called - appearances stated. 
Defendant Tristan D. Schroeder in court.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 



Court informs defendant of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Defendant states understanding.  Right to counsel is explained. 
Def. states understanding
Def. requests court appointed attorney
Court questions whether def. has applied to Public Def. - Def. states he has not
Court advises Def. to apply to Public Def first, if he does not qualify court will entertain a petition for court appointed attorney
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 8, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Hearing on May 23, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

1:23 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Tristan D. Schroeder appeared by video.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court finds probable cause. 

State is heard on bond. $500.00 cash bond. No contact with TS and CS. Defendant shall have no contact with the 600 Block of N Michigan Street. Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages. Defendant is to submit to random PBT at request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. 

Defendant is heard. 

Court orders a $500.00 cash bond. No contact with TS and CS. Defendant shall have no contact with the 600 Block of N Michigan Street. Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages. Defendant is to submit to random PBT at request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw.
Hearing scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
